original_solution_mapping.L1: Grace can read 200/20 = <<200/20=10>>10 pages in 1 hour.
original_solution_mapping.L2: So she can finish a 250-page book in 250/10 = <<250/10=25>>25 hours.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 684.
    Returns: the time it would take Grace to finish reading the new book.
    """
    # L1
    total_pages_initial_book = 200 # a 200-page book
    time_to_read_initial_book = 20 # in 20 hours
    pages_per_hour = total_pages_initial_book / time_to_read_initial_book

    # L2
    pages_new_book = 250 # a 250-page book
    time_to_read_new_book = pages_new_book / pages_per_hour

    # FA
    answer = time_to_read_new_book
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Grace can read {total_pages_initial_book}/{time_to_read_initial_book} = <<{total_pages_initial_book}/{time_to_read_initial_book}={pages_per_hour}>>{pages_per_hour} pages in 1 hour.
So she can finish a {pages_new_book}/{pages_per_hour} = <<{pages_new_book}/{pages_per_hour}={time_to_read_new_book}>>{time_to_read_new_book} hours.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Grace can read 20/20 = <<20/20=1>>1 pages in 1 hour.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: So she can finish a 250/1 = <<250/1=250>>250 hours.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'time_to_read_initial_book' (20) was used instead of 'total_pages_initial_book' (200).
